creature_ability: Terrain Advantage Non- lizardfolk  creatures that are in  difficult terrain  or are in water and lack a swim Speed are  off-guard  to the lizardfolk scout.

markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Lizardfolk Scout](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3091)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Iruxi scouts are the lizardfolk most often encountered by adventurers, for these unsentimental  explorers and hunters spend most of their lives on the move, constantly patrolling the territories held by their enclave. If intruders are driven off, it is the responsibility of iruxi scouts to track them, observe them, and learn their ways and weaknesses so as to report back to the community and aid in the defense against potential reprisals.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 15

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 10
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Lizardfolk_Scout.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 1">[Lizardfolk Scout](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3091)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
<trait label="Lizardfolk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=760" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 227 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Perception** +8

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Iruxi](/Languages.aspx?ID=32)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +6, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +5, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +4, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +6, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +6, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +8

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +2

**Dex** +3

**Con** +1

**Int** -1

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +1
</row>

**Deep Breath** A lizardfolk scout can [hold their breath](/Rules.aspx?ID=468) for 15 minutes.

**Items**
[Blowgun](/Weapons.aspx?ID=66) (10 darts), 1 of which is coated with [giant centipede venom](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2898))

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 17 

**Fort** +6 

**Ref** +8 

**Will** +6 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 17

</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, swim 20 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +7,
**Damage** 1d6+2 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tail +8 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)),
**Damage** 1d4+2 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
blowgun +8 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [range increment 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1 piercing plus giant centipede venom

**Giant Centipede Venom**  ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 14 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 1d4 poison damage (1 round); **Stage 2** 1d4 poison damage and [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) (1 round); **Stage 3** 1d4 poison damage, [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61), and [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73) (1 round)

**Hidden Movement**   If the lizardfolk scout starts its turn [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79) from or [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=96) by a creature, that creature is [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) against the scout's attacks until the end of the turn.

**[Sneak Attack](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=34)**   The lizardfolk scout deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) creatures.

**Terrain Advantage Non-[lizardfolk](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=441) creatures that are in [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) or are in water and lack a swim Speed are [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) to the lizardfolk scout.**   

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-441" />
name: Lizardfolk Scout

If intruders are driven off, it is the responsibility of iruxi scouts to track them, observe them, and learn their ways and weaknesses so as to report back to the community and aid in the defense against potential reprisals.
